p: Experimental results revealed that all essential oils from eleven Egyptian plants were to various degree repellent to I. ricinus nymphs. The most active essential oils were C. dioscoridis, A. herba alba and C. officinalis that elicited strong repellent activity against tick nymphs by 94, 84.2 and 82.0%, respectively (Table 2). The F. vulgare and A. majus oils revealed moderate repellent activity by 70.6 and 68.3%, respectively. The oils from L. camara, A. visnaga, R. communis, and N. oleander elicited repellency by 63.3, 62.4, 61.2, and 60%, respectively. A minimum repellent activity was observed by the oils of L. inermis and M. recutita (Table 2).
